isSequential

public boolean isSequential()
Description copied from interface: Classifier
A classifier that is based on a sequence of labels (i.e. computes/optimizes label transition probabilities) such as the MalletCRFClassifier should return true. Here is the expectation for implementors. If true is returned, then the classifier may or may not implement classify(List<Feature>) (usually not we expect) and must override classify(List<List<Feature>>). If false is returned, then the classifier is required to implement classify(List<Feature>) and may or many not override classify(List<List<Feature>>). If you do not want to implement classify(List<Feature>) for your sequential classifier, then simply throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
isSequential in interface Classifier<Boolean>
Specified by:
isSequential in class Classifier_ImplBase<Boolean,Boolean,FeatureVector>
Returns:
true if this is a sequential classifier, false otherwise.
See Also:
MalletCRFClassifier.isSequential(), MaxentClassifier.isSequential()
